meanings.definition: Covered with wool or something resembling wool.
meanings.sent1: The sheep had a wooly coat to keep it warm.
meanings.sent2: Her sweater felt soft and wooly against her skin.
meanings.sent3: The wooly blanket made the baby giggle as it tickled her toes.
meanings.sent4: The fog hung low over the city, creating a wooly blanket of mist.
meanings.sent5: The wooly clouds in the sky looked like fluffy cotton candy.

meanings.definition: Made of wool or a wool-like material.
meanings.sent1: She knitted a wooly scarf for her best friend.
meanings.sent2: The wooly socks kept his feet cozy during the winter.
meanings.sent3: The wooly hat made him look like a cute little bear.
meanings.sent4: The wooly sweater was so warm, it felt like a hug.
meanings.sent5: The wooly blanket was perfect for snuggling on the couch.

meanings.definition: Resembling wool in texture or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The plant had a wooly leaf that felt fuzzy to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The caterpillar had a wooly body covered in tiny hairs.
meanings.sent3: The wooly fabric on the chair made it look like a cozy throne.
meanings.sent4: The wooly clouds in the sky drifted lazily on a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The wooly texture of the painting added depth and warmth to the room.
